pages.text: A $(item)$(bold)Campfire$() is an indispensable component to wilderness survival and, as such, the knowledge required to construct a $(item)$(bold)Campfire$() is a mandatory requirement in all VFD wilderness survival toolkits.

When huddled together in the dead of night $(italic)- a phrase here which means a time in the middle part of the night, when it is darkest and coldest -$() a $(item)$(bold)Campfire$() can be used to heighten anticipation and dread while recreationally engaging in scintillating and predictable tales of horror and misfortune. However, for a person in your predicament, heightening your anticipation and dread for recreational purposes is probably not a priority.

I imagine, for a person in your predicament, a person engaged in the horror and misfortune of wilderness survival in a very non-recreational, non-scintillating, and unpredictable way, $(bold)$(thing)a $(item)Campfire$() $(bold)$(thing)is most useful for cooking food and creating light$() - the kind of light that acts as a comfort against the anticipation and dread that is inevitably heightened in the middle part of the night, when it is darkest and coldest.

This guide, also being an indispensable component to wilderness survival and a mandatory requirement in all VFD wilderness survival toolkits, naturally contains the necessary knowledge required to construct and make use of just such a $(item)$(bold)Campfire$().
To construct a $(item)$(bold)Campfire$(), follow these four easy steps:$(li)Craft $(l:survive/tinder)Tinder$()$(li)Place $(l:survive/tinder)Tinder$()$(li)Add logs$(li)Ignite

pages.title: Craft Tinder
pages.text: First, you will need some $(l:survive/tinder)Tinder$() - $(italic)a word here which means a dry, flammable material, such as sticks or plant fibers, that is often used to aid in lighting a fire$() - to aid in lighting your fire.

Finally, use any $(l:appendix/ignition)VFD approved ignition aid$() to ignite.$(p)$(italic)~ Author's Notes:$()$(p)  I have used a $(item)$(bold)Campfire$() very similar to the one illustrated within these pages to cook food and it is because of this experience, or rather your inexperience, that I would like to tell you that the experience of cooking on an open flame is a joyous one, but I cannot.

What I can tell you, from the experience of many hungry nights, is that $(bold)$(thing)food left cooking unattended will burn$().$(p)  I can also tell you that $(bold)$(thing)a shovel is required to remove ash$() and that $(bold)$(thing)a $(item)$(bold)Campfire$() $(bold)$(thing)can be extinguished by rain or a bucket of water$().
